instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not powering up
threads.message: Have this unit that isn't powering up. Found the cause to be audio/ IO board on the left of the palmrest. The board and the cable were corroded. Once i replaced this, both usb-c ports are now going to 20v but never powers up. Trying using the T2 bridge restore but keep getting this message/error (see picture). Has anyone see this before.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not powering up
threads.message:
Several T2 lines go to RIO board (J6100).
T2 chip could be now damaged...
